title: (+Vote) Which one is your favorite meta ?
body:
https://imgur.com/a/091RabY



+1 so everyone see and vote

replies.body:
Why isn't there an option for "neither?" Neither is good but for different reasons. Censor meta was boring and over-reliant on a certain type of ADC and support, and the game currently has too much damage in general and burst in particular. This poll is like trying to determine if dogs or cats are better pets by asking if people prefer stepping in dog shit barefoot or waking up with cat piss on your pillow: Both options suck and people generally agree on that.

I'm hoping for what's to come with all the subtle moves Riot has been making to tone down damage and help out a few tanks while also laying out a plan to address damage more thoroughly in the preseason. That'll likely be a much better meta than either one in the poll.

> [{quoted}](name=Draffyr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7aWB2wj,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-08-06T21:48:35.223+0000)
>
> Why isn't there an option for "neither?" Neither is good but for different reasons. Censor meta was boring and over-reliant on a certain type of ADC and support, and the game currently has too much damage in general and burst in particular. This poll is like trying to determine if dogs or cats are better pets by asking if people prefer stepping in dog shit barefoot or waking up with cat piss on your pillow: Both options suck and people generally agree on that.
> 
> I'm hoping for what's to come with all the subtle moves Riot has been making to tone down damage and help out a few tanks while also laying out a plan to address damage more thoroughly in the preseason. That'll likely be a much better meta than either one in the poll.

Cats > Dogs everyone knows it.
Psh, the push for a cat meta is over. The dog meta is clearly superior in the modern ideal of teamwork over solo play.

Neither for me as well.

Mainly because Shen is absolute garbage in both metas and doesn't qualify to be an actual, contributing champion to the game if your team isn't more coordinated than a barbershop quartet.

started season 1 and i say

top: season 5
jung: season 5
adc: season 5
support: season 5
mid: season 7

tank meta's are good cause they enable all other roles to be useful just aslong as it doesnt fucking involve twitch/kog/varus/kaisa/janna/lulu which makes everything useless
this. s3 ~ s4 ~ s5

Completely agree.

It's like League's circle of life.
If tanks are necessary we need marksman/dot mages, to kill them we need burst mages, to kill both the mages and marksman we need assassins/divers/juggernauts/skirmishers, then we need mages/tanks/enchanters to peel those.

And the cycle starts all over again.
But remove tanks from that, and the cycle dies because we don't have any reliable front line peel/engage and very squishy team compositions
Literally the best possible way it could've been said.
Whichever meta season 3 was

Assassin meta. Namely Kassadin, LB and Talon with a Nidalee somewhere inbetween.

tank meta

with more tanks in low tier than high and the majority of meta picks in top/jungle/supp being non tanks

 {{champion:33}}  okay

Tbh you probs shoulda split it like this:

Tank/mage (s5)
Assassin/adc (s 7, 8, 3)
Diver/smirmisher (s4)
Adc (s6)

A little bit of everything  (s5 post cinderhulk sej nerfs).


Smashing everything into those 2 categories isn't accurate at all and this would be a better representation.
Personally I'd pick my final suggestion. Because the meta is flexible af and I can play my favourite champs anywhere. 
I can peel those assassins and enable my carries to kill the pesky vayne that's shredding my girthy health bar.

This is fundamentally a skewed poll.

You can still play assassins in a non-assassin meta.  You are still impactful.

If you pick a champ that needs 2 items to be relevant in season 8, you might as well be inting.  You will probably never have any meaningful impact on your game.
I had to vote for the right, because unfortunately with the tank meta Nocturne is deleted from the game.

Both of these metas are bad, for different reasons.  Ignoring items / runes /etc, 7.17 was _terrible_ in terms of bot and top champions while 8.15 has an incredibly obnoxious pool of jungle and midlane champs, with a few nasty tops as well.  Including items and runes, 7.17 was Ardent Hell and 8.15 is the land of getting 100-0'd by half the roster.

I Personally prefer...

Top Lane V8.15
Jungle V7.17
Mid V7.17
Bot Lane V7.17 & V8.15
Support V7.17

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/5/51/Everything_is_Okay_Emote.png/revision/latest?cb=20180322145328

###_Get's triggered by the fact that Varus_
###_isn't mentioned in bot lane for both patch V7.17 and V8.15._

Wasn't 7.17 still in the Ardent Meta which was universally hated here? You know, the time everyone complained that Janna existed? Funny how quickly everyone outgrew it despite it in its prime being more universally hated than release Zoe.
I really liked when funneling was strong
Name checks out. {{champion:30}}
It's fun to see aurelion sol doing good in both meta.
Rengar being beastly in the top lane is nice, I never want to see ranged top laner a meta

I mean at least there were a few S teir champs that can be banned out like Jayce or Sej and you would know that nobody else would be insanely good, now there are way too many good picks and if you dont play the OP shit you will be stomped
And adcs could be countered by CC or assassins and tanks could be countered by pen, now its just who can oneshot the other faster or who can have the tankier stats so they can 1 v 5 ({{champion:122}} {{champion:24}} )
Can't say I like any of these. I think my favorite meta was after ardent meta, but before huge adc nerf. In soloQ it was around March, not sure what meta took place there.
Nidalee 1 shot javelin meta.
What a coincidence that in assassin/fighter meta there more champions viable. Almost like tanks force adc to play hyper carries, fighters to play anti tanks and mages to play utility.
s6 before assasin rework.(and before they gutted kindred)

I can't pick one because these tier lists are hilariously wrong outside of bot lane for both patches. Like take jungle for example, the S tier picks are just wrong, Rammus hasn't been S tier in forever, he hasn't gotten changes that would make him S tier. Sej wasn't S tier late last year at all, and right now she is really good and isn't even B tier? What the hell are these lists lol. Why is Morde a S tier pick, in what world is he S tier lmao!!!
There is no mages meta?

> [{quoted}](name=Noor Sakata,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7aWB2wj,comment-id=0043,timestamp=2018-08-07T20:17:56.606+0000)
>

Mages were always relevant. Sometimes less sometimes more. There was never a "mage meta" as far as im aware

> [{quoted}](name=LF Trans Girl GF,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7aWB2wj,comment-id=00430000,timestamp=2018-08-07T20:24:56.934+0000)
>
> Mages were always relevant. Sometimes less sometimes more. There was never a "mage meta" as far as im aware

As a mages main I sure don't want a mages meta , there are a lot of them that can be cancerous to handle already , but we really need to get rid of this meta we are in

I only chose the right for the simple fact that there's a lot more diversity
I don't like metas where theres 1-2 goldly champions for each class, making it impossible for other champions to thrive
In metas like on the right theres more even numbers, allowing you more picks

Neither. 

This is the meta I would like to see;


Tanks have more damage resistance and less damage
ADCs have more sustained damage and DPS
Assassins have more burst for eliminating squishy targets
Supports have more utility for keeping ADC alive and CCing targets
Bruisers have less tankiness but more sustain

I call it the balanced meta.

> [{quoted}](name=RoG Seraph,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7aWB2wj,comment-id=0041,timestamp=2018-08-07T17:05:56.245+0000)
>
> Neither. 
> 
> This is the meta I would like to see;
> 
> 
> Tanks have more damage resistance and less damage
> ADCs have more sustained damage and DPS
> Assassins have more burst for eliminating squishy targets
> Supports have more utility for keeping ADC alive and CCing targets
> Bruisers have less tankiness but more sustain
> 
> I call it the balanced meta.

And mages with strong AoE spells but high mana penalty to prevent spamming.

> [{quoted}](name=Seen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=L7aWB2wj,comment-id=00410000,timestamp=2018-08-07T17:48:43.038+0000)
>
> And mages with strong AoE spells but high mana penalty to prevent spamming.

YES! Also would prevent them from just spamming abilities to clear waves indefinitely.

Lol, my girl Annie and my boy Veigar don’t even make the list.

Also how exactly is Sona S tier in this meta? She was great in Censor meta but she sucks right now. Super low HP, low resistances, her mana costs are high and her abilities barely do anything early game. She was strong with klepto in the beginning of the season so Riot gutted her. Then they nerfed all her runes. Then they nerfed the tear she liked to build for mana sustain. She actually feels absolutely awful to play until you get 3 items on a support salary, if your game even lasts that long. Her poke is completely irrelevant in lane, which was like the whole thing she did, so you may as well be a 300g caster minion until 15 minutes. Really wish Riot would look into her but everyone knows Riot sort of hates Sona as a champion so I guess we just keep waiting for the VGU.
on left its all but tank meta... just saying.
llica

Tank- as a tank sup (mostly Leo and Thresh)

Not for the reason you think though.

I mean look at all those DELICIOUS SQUISHY TARGETS for me botlane in a tank meta. Ahahahaha!
Interesting how ahri was considered to have hard mechanics in season 7 and in season 8 she became average.

Any META hit with Morello's nerf bat will do just fine for me.

You know what?  There are over 100 champions in this game now...  I don't think it's that important for every single one of them to be 'viable'.  Maybe it was important back when there were fewer than 100 champions, but it's just not that important anymore.  There are bigger priorities, like this 'rune' system that's so horrible I've not been able to say one good thing about it since it was conceived as an idea and announced to the player base except this: you can arrange your 'runes' in champion select.  Whoop Dee Doo!
I like the original Cinderhulk meta where team fights lasted for 20-30 seconds sometimes. But, you know, Riot decided that such things weren't to last.
